page.title: 03Communications
page.content: The majority of the families have telephones, possibly those who have not are those in greatest need of them but find the charges expensive. Five telephone boxes are in the area and local people have backed the Women's Institute7s countrywide camp@aign to keep an adequate number of boxes on the roadsides. A new technique, fibre optic cable, is laid underground lon the small section of A12 road 23/46. This feeds into Kesgrave telephone exchange. There is an adequate number of pillar-boxes for letters. Two collections and two deliveries of letter post are made daily, except on Saturday - one of each. parcel post has one delivery on six days but there are no postal services at all on Sunday.
